mn1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.
mn1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the bhikkhus,
mn1:2.1: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the explanation of the root of all phenomena.
mn1:2.2: Listen and apply your minds well, I will speak.”
mn1:3.1: “Take an unlearned ordinary person who has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. He has not seen the righteous men, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the righteous men.
mn1:3.3: Having perceived earth as earth, he conceives in earth, he conceives apart from earth, he conceives ‘earth is mine’, he delights in earth.
mn1:3.5: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:4.2: Having perceived water as water, he conceives water …
mn1:4.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:5.2: Having perceived fire as fire, he conceives fire …
mn1:5.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:6.2: Having perceived air as air, he conceives air …
mn1:6.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:7.2: Having perceived beings as beings, he conceives beings …
mn1:7.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:8.2: Having perceived gods as gods, he conceives gods …
mn1:8.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:9.1: He perceives the Progenitor as the Progenitor.
mn1:9.2: Having perceived the Progenitor as the Progenitor, he conceives the Progenitor …
mn1:9.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:10.2: Having perceived Brahmā as Brahmā, he conceives Brahmā …
mn1:10.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:11.1: He perceives those of streaming radiance as those of streaming radiance.
mn1:11.2: Having perceived those of streaming radiance as those of streaming radiance, he conceives those of streaming radiance …
mn1:11.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:12.1: He perceives those replete with glory as those replete with glory.
mn1:12.2: Having perceived those replete with glory as those replete with glory, he conceives those replete with glory …
mn1:12.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:13.1: He perceives those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit.
mn1:13.2: Having perceived those of abundant fruit as those of abundant fruit, he conceives those of abundant fruit …
mn1:13.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:14.1: He perceives the Conqueror as the Conqueror.
mn1:14.2: Having perceived the Conqueror as the Conqueror, he conceives the Conqueror …
mn1:14.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:15.1: He perceives the extent of infinite space as the extent of infinite space.
mn1:15.2: Having perceived the extent of infinite space as the extent of infinite space, he conceives the extent of infinite space …
mn1:15.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:16.1: He perceives the extent of infinite consciousness as the extent of infinite consciousness.
mn1:16.2: Having perceived the extent of infinite consciousness as the extent of infinite consciousness, he conceives the extent of infinite consciousness …
mn1:16.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:17.1: He perceives the extent of nothingness as the extent of nothingness.
mn1:17.2: Having perceived the extent of nothingness as the extent of nothingness, he conceives the extent of nothingness …
mn1:17.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:18.1: He perceives the extent of neither-perception-nor-non-perception as the extent of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
mn1:18.2: Having perceived the extent of neither-perception-nor-non-perception as the extent of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, he conceives the extent of neither-perception-nor-non-perception …
mn1:18.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:19.1: He perceives the seen as the seen.
mn1:19.2: Having perceived the seen as the seen, he conceives the seen …
mn1:19.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:20.1: He perceives the heard as the heard.
mn1:20.2: Having perceived the heard as the heard, he conceives the heard …
mn1:20.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:21.1: He perceives the thought as the thought.
mn1:21.2: Having perceived the thought as the thought, he conceives the thought …
mn1:21.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:22.1: He perceives the known as the known.
mn1:22.2: Having perceived the known as the known, he conceives the known …
mn1:22.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:23.2: Having perceived unity as unity, he conceives unity …
mn1:23.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:24.2: Having perceived multiplicity as multiplicity, he conceives multiplicity …
mn1:24.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:25.1: He perceives the All as the All.
mn1:25.2: Having perceived the All as the All, he conceives the All …
mn1:25.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:26.2: Having perceived Nibbāna as Nibbāna, he conceives Nibbāna, he conceives in Nibbāna, he conceives apart from Nibbāna, he conceives ‘Nibbāna is mine’, he delights in Nibbāna.
mn1:26.4: Because he has not fully understood it, I say.
mn1:27.1: A bhikkhu who is a trainee, who has not achieved his goal, but lives aspiring to the supreme safety from the yoke, comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:27.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, let him not conceive earth, let him not conceive in earth, let him not conceive apart from earth, let him not conceive ‘earth is mine’, let him not delight in earth.
mn1:27.4: So that he may completely understand it, I say.

mn1:51.1: A bhikkhu who is an Arahant—with influxes destroyed, who is consummate, has done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved the highest goal, utterly destroyed the fetter of being, and is liberated by right understanding—comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:51.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:51.4: Because he has fully understood it, I say.

mn1:123.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.

mn1:147.1: The Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha, comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:147.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:147.4: Because the Realized One has fully understood it to the end, I say.

mn1:170.4: Because the Realized One has fully understood it to the end, I say.
mn1:171.1: The Realized One, the Arahant, the fully awakened Buddha, comprehends earth as earth.
mn1:171.2: Having comprehended earth as earth, he does not conceive earth, he does not conceive in earth, he does not conceive apart from earth, he does not conceive ‘earth is mine’, he does not delight in earth.
mn1:171.4: Because he has understood that delight is the root of suffering,
mn1:171.5: and that with being [existence] there is birth; one who exists ages and dies.
mn1:171.6: That is why the Realized One—with the ending, fading away, cessation, giving up, and letting go of all cravings—has awakened to the supreme perfect Awakening, I say.
